page.title: 03Survey of Parents in Codsall
page.content: Car parking is thought to be adequate except around Birches Bridge. Public Transport is adequate with regular bus and train services to W'ton though most parents would use their car. When asked what they liked most about living in Codsall, most parents stated that its location, between town & countryside was important. Other factors were proximity to shops, services and roads especially M6 & M54,sports facilities, friendly people, village atmosphere and good schools. There is scope for improvement, according to many parents. Among possibilities are better footpaths,more facilities for children, and the control of dogs, litter and traffic. Among some of Codsall's more established residents there was a sense that the village had already grown too much and a concern about the loss of village atmosphere was expressed.
